alert.note: Alert for Shawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 09 at 4:31PM CDT until May 09 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CDT FOR WESTERN FRANKLIN...SOUTH CENTRAL SHAWNEE...WESTERN ANDERSON... OSAGE...COFFEY AND SOUTHERN LYON COUNTIES... At 430 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Overbrook to 4 miles south of Waverly to 4 miles southeast of Madison, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Osage City, Burlington, Carbondale, Auburn, Overbrook, Lyndon, Lebo, Burlingame, Scranton, Waverly, Olpe, New Strawn, Quenemo, Melvern, Hartford, Gridley, Neosho Rapids, Reading, Westphalia and Olivet. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 140 and 170. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 156 and 173. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
